text: A leper window was a window built low in the chancel wall of some medieval churches. It was usually iron barred and shuttered. Lepers stood outside and watched Mass through this window. == References == * Broderick, R. C. The Catholic Concise Encyclopedia. 1952. Simon & Schuster. p. 222. * Dictionary: Leper window Category:Church architecture Category:Windows (architecture)
